conclusion: Analyze the flow paths from points A, B, and C to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
Liquid flows downward from point A.
Liquid from A encounters the first baffle, which directs it to the right.
Liquid from A continues to flow down and encounters the second baffle, which directs it to the left.
Liquid from A flows into container D.
Liquid flows downward from point B.
Liquid from B encounters the first baffle, which directs it to the right.
Liquid from B continues to flow down and encounters the second baffle, which directs it to the left.
Liquid from B flows into container D.
Liquid flows downward from point C.
Liquid from C encounters the first baffle, which directs it to the right.
Liquid from C continues to flow down and encounters the second baffle, which directs it to the left.
Liquid from C flows into container D.
All flow paths from points A, B, and C lead the liquid into container D.
The liquid will flow into container D after passing through the baffles.
